articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mikhail Prosmitskiy)
articles.description: WCAG is evolving. Since 1999, the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines have defined accessibility in binary terms: either a success criterion is met or not. But real user experience is rarely that simple. WCAG 3.0 rethinks the model ‚Äî prioritizing usability over compliance and shifting the focus toward the quality of access rather than the mere presence of features. Could this be the start of a new era in accessibility?
articles.title: WCAG 3.0‚Äôs Proposed Scoring Model: A Shift In Accessibility Evaluation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)

articles.title: Make Every Day Count (May 2025 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anima Team)
articles.description: As designers, it‚Äôs important to be able to transform visual ideas into concepts within minutes and into fully functional products within hours. Well, today we‚Äôre bringing you closer to AnimaApp, an app designed to make your life easier ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre a designer, developer, product team member or entrepreneur.
articles.title: How To Turn Your Figma Designs Into Live Apps With Anima Playground

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Lost in a sea of UX files, docs, PDFs, and scattered decisions across Slack, Dropbox, Notion, and Figma? Kindly powered by [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com).

In this guide, Talke Hoppmann-Walton walks you through a ‚ÄúProduct Kondo‚Äù exercise to declutter, realign, and spark some serious product joy for both your business and your customers.
articles.title: ‚ÄúProduct Kondo‚Äù: A Guide To Evaluating Your Organizational Product Portfolio

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marina Chernyshova)
articles.description: While it is clear that creativity is driven by both the left and right hemispheres, an important question remains: how can we boost creativity while keeping the process enjoyable? It may not be obvious, but non-design-related activities can, in fact, be an opportunity to enhance creativity.
articles.title: Boosting Up Your Creativity Without Endless Reference Scrolling

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Amejimaobari Ollornwi)
articles.description: Poor internet connectivity doesn‚Äôt have to mean poor UX.
